rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:Class schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Dravidian languages</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:mainEntityOfPage </span> <div rel='schema:mainEntityOfPage' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000033311101161' typeof='schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource'> <span class='type'>schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Dravidian languages [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:about </span> <div rel='schema:about' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000033311102461' typeof='schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Dravidian languages</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>The Dravidian languages are a language family spoken mainly in southern India and parts of eastern and central India, as well as in northeastern Sri Lanka with small pockets in Southwestern Pakistan, Southern Afghanistan, Nepal, Bangladesh and Bhutan, and overseas in other countries such as Malaysia and Singapore. The Dravidian languages with the most speakers are Telugu, Tamil, Kannada and Malayalam. There are also small groups of Dravidian-speaking scheduled tribes, who live beyond the mainstream communities, such as the Kurukh and Gond tribes. Though some argue that the Dravidian languages may have been brought to India by migrations in the fourth or third millennium BCE or even earlier, the Dravidian languages cannot easily be connected to any other language, and they could well be indigenous to India. Epigraphically the Dravidian languages have been attested since the 2nd century BCE. Only two Dravidian languages are exclusively spoken outside India: Brahui in Pakistan and Dhangar, a dialect of Kurukh, in Nepal. Dravidian place names along the Arabian Sea coast and the Dravidian grammatical influence such as clusivity in the Indo-Aryan languages, namely Marathi, Konkani, Gujarati, Marwari and Sindhi languages, suggest that Dravidian languages were once spoken more widely across the Indian subcontinent.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Dravidian languages</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:termCode </span> <span property='schema:termCode'>Q33311</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>The Dravidian languages are a language family spoken mainly in southern India and parts of eastern and central India. [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:inLanguage </span> <a href='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000007976104261' property='schema:inLanguage'>https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000007976104261</a> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Dravidian languages [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Dravidian languages</span> class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>Georgian (ქართული ენა tr. Kartuli ena) არის ქართველური ენის ცოდნა ქართველებს. ეს არის საქართველოს სახელმწიფო ენას. ქართული დაწერილი საკუთარი წერის სისტემა, ქართული დამწერლობის. ქართველი ლიტერატურული ენის ყველა რეგიონალური ქვეჯგუფი ქართველი, მათ შორის, ვინც საუბრობენ სხვა ქართველური ენები: სვანები, მეგრელები და ლაზები.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>ქართული ენა</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:termCode </span> <span property='schema:termCode'>Q8108</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>Georgian is a Kartvelian language spoken by Georgians. It is the official language of Georgia. resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000169921101161' typeof='schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource'> <span class='type'>schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Ibero-Caucasian languages [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:about </span> <div rel='schema:about' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000169921102461' typeof='schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Ibero-Caucasian languages</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>The term Ibero-Caucasian (or Iberian-Caucasian) was proposed by Georgian linguist Arnold Chikobava for the union of the three language families that are specific to the Caucasus, namely * Kartvelian * Northwest Caucasian, also called Circassian * Northeast Caucasian, also called Nakho–Dagestanian. The Ibero-Caucasian phylum would also include three extinct languages: Hattic, connected by some linguists to the Northwest (Circassian) family, and Hurrian and Urartian, connected to the Northeast (Nakh–Dagestanian) family.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Ibero-Caucasian languages</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:termCode </span> <span property='schema:termCode'>Q169921</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>The term Ibero-Caucasian was proposed by Georgian linguist Arnold Chikobava for the union of the three language families that are specific to the Caucasus. [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:inLanguage </span> <a href='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000007976104261' property='schema:inLanguage'>https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000007976104261</a> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Ibero-Caucasian languages [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Ibero-Caucasian languages</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:sameAs </span> <ul> <li> <a href='http://dbpedia.org/page/Ibero-Caucasian_languages' property='schema:sameAs'>http://dbpedia.org/page/Ibero-Caucasian_languages</a> </li> <li> <a href='https://m.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:EntityData/Q169921.json' property='schema:sameAs'>https://m.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:EntityData/Q169921.json</a> </li> <li> <a href='https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q169921' property='schema:sameAs'>https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q169921</a> </li> </ul> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:supersededBy </span> <a href='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010020162172109161' property='schema:supersededBy'>https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010020162172109161</a> </div> </div> </div> </div> <div resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000008798109161' typeof='schema:Class schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:Class schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Ukrainian</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:mainEntityOfPage </span> <div rel='schema:mainEntityOfPage' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000008798101158' typeof='schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource'> <span class='type'>schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Ukrainian language [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:about </span> <div rel='schema:about' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000008798102458' typeof='schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>українська мова</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>Український / juːkreɪniən / (українська мова ukrayins &#39;мова, вимовляється [ukrɑjiɲsʲkɐ mɔwɐ]) є мова східнослов&#39;янського. Він є офіційною державною мовою України та першим з двох основних мов українців; це один з трьох офіційних мов в невизнаній ПМР, два інших молдавською та російською мовами. Письмове Український використовує варіант кирилиці (див українського алфавіту). До 20-го століття він був відомий як Літтл-російську мову (російську: малоросійський мову, малоросійську мову) від царизму Московії і пізніше Росії ампір, в той час як в Польщі, так і в Австро-Угорщині в якості мови русинів або русинської мови (польський : język Руські, rusiński, німецький: ruthenische Sprache). Історичні лінгвісти простежити походження української мови до Старого східнослов&#39;янського раннього середньовічного держави Київської Русі. Після падіння Київської Русі, а також Галицько-Волинського, мова розвинувся в форму, звану русинську мову. Сучасна українська мова був в загальному користуванні, починаючи з кінцем 17-го століття, пов&#39;язаний зі створенням Гетьманщини. З 1804 до російської революції, українська мова була заборонена з шкіл в Російській імперії, з яких більша частина України (Центральної, Східної та Південної) був частиною в той час. Він завжди підтримував достатню базу в Західній Україні, де мова ніколи не заборонена, в фольклорних пісень, мандрівних музикантів і відомих авторів. Стандарт української мови регулюється Національної академії наук України (НАНУ), зокрема, його Інститутом української мови, української мови інформаційного фонду і Потебня Інституту вивчення мови. Лексичний, найближчий мову Українського білорус (84% від загальної лексики), а потім польського (70%), Південно-слов&#39;янський (68%), Словаччина (66%) і російською (62%). Українська мова зберігає ступінь взаємної зрозумілості з білоруським і російською мовами.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>українська мова</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:termCode </span> <span property='schema:termCode'>Q8798</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>Ukrainian is an East Slavic language. It is the official state language of Ukraine. [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:image </span> <div rel='schema:image' schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Swedish</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:mainEntityOfPage </span> <div rel='schema:mainEntityOfPage' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009027101154' typeof='schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource'> <span class='type'>schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Swedish language [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:about </span> <div rel='schema:about' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009027102454' typeof='schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>svenska</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>Svenska ([²svɛnːska]) är en nordgermanska språk talas inbyggt med mer än 9 miljoner människor huvudsakligen i Sverige och delar av Finland, där den har samma rättsliga ställning med finska. Det är till stor del ömsesidigt begripligt med norska och danska (se avsnittet &quot;Classification&quot;). Tillsammans med de övriga nordiska språk, är svenska ättling till fornnordiska, det gemensamma språket i de germanska folk som lever i Skandinavien under vikingatiden. Det är för närvarande den största av de nordiska språk med antalet högtalare. Standard svenska, som talas av de flesta svenskar är det nationella språket som utvecklats från de central svenska dialekter i 19-talet och var väl etablerad i början av 20-talet. Medan olika regionala sorter härstammar från de äldre dialekter landsbygden fortfarande existerar, det talade och skrivna språket är enhetlig och standardiserad. Standard ordföljden är, liksom i de flesta germanska språk, V2, vilket innebär att det finita verbet visas på andra plats av en deklarativ huvudsats. Svensk morfologi liknar engelska; det vill säga ord har förhållandevis få böjningar. Det finns två kön, inga grammatiska fall och en distinktion mellan plural och singular. Äldre analyser posit fallen nominativ och genitiv och det finns några rester av olika ackusativ och dativa former liksom. Adjektiv jämförs som på engelska, och är också böjas efter kön, antal och bestämdhet. Definitenessen substantiv markeras främst genom suffix (ändelser), kompletterad med separata bestämd och obestämd artiklar. Prosodin har både stress och i de flesta dialekter tonala kvaliteter. Språket har en jämförelsevis stor vokal inventering. Svenska är också känd för det tonlöst dorso-palatal velar frikativa, en mycket varierande konsonant fonem.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>svenska</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:termCode </span> <span property='schema:termCode'>Q9027</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>Swedish is a North Germanic language, spoken natively by more than 9 million people predominantly in Sweden and parts of Finland, where it has equal legal standing with Finnish. [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:image </span> <div rel='schema:image' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009027102154' typeof='schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:MediaObject schema:ImageObject'> <span class='type'>schema:CreativeWork </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:subjectOf </span> <a href='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009027104254' property='schema:subjectOf'>https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009027104254</a> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>svenska</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:sameAs </span> <a href='https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Svenska' [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Swedish</span> </div> <div href='https://m.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:EntityData/Q9027.json' property='schema:sameAs'>https://m.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:EntityData/Q9027.json</a> </li> <li> <a href='http://dbpedia.org/page/Swedish_language' property='schema:sameAs'>http://dbpedia.org/page/Swedish_language</a> </li> </ul> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:supersededBy </span> <a href='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000019860109161' property='schema:supersededBy'>https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000019860109161</a> </div> </div> <div resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009056109161' typeof='schema:Class schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:Class schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Czech</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:mainEntityOfPage </span> <div rel='schema:mainEntityOfPage' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009056101134' typeof='schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource'> <span class='type'>schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Czech language [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:about </span> <div rel='schema:about' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009056102434' typeof='schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>čeština</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>Český (/ tʃɛk /; čeština výslovnost čeština: [t͡ʃɛʃcɪna]; historicky i česká) je West slovanský jazyk skupiny české-slovenské. To je mluvené více než 10 milionů lidí a je úředním jazykem v České republice. Česká úzce souvisí slovenštiny, do té míry vzájemné srozumitelnosti. České a Slovenské úzce souvisí s ostatními West slovanské jazyky, jako je Slezské a polštině. Skupina České-slovenské vyvinut v rámci západoslovanských ve vysokém středověkého období, a standardizace českého a slovenského rámci kontinua dialektu České-slovenském objeví v raném novověku. V pozdějším 18. do poloviny 19. století, moderní psaný standard byl kodifikován v rámci hlavního mateřštině Česká národní Revival.The, známý jako společný češtiny, je založen na mateřštině Prahy, ale je nyní mluvený skrz většinu českých Republika. Tyto Moravština mluvený ve východní části země, jsou většinou také počítají jako česky, i když některé ze svých východních variant jsou blíže k Slovensku. Je Česká foném inventář je střední velikosti, který obsahuje pět samohlásek (každý krátký nebo dlouhý) a dvacet pět souhlásek (rozdělené do „tvrdé“, „neutrální“ a kategorie „měkké“). Slova mohou obsahovat méně časté (nebo komplikované) shluky souhlásek, včetně jednoho souhlásky reprezentován grapheme R, nebo nedostatek samohlásek dohromady. Český pravopis je jednoduchá, a byl používán jako model phonologists.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>čeština</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:termCode </span> <span property='schema:termCode'>Q9056</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>Czech is a West Slavic language of the Czech-Slovak group. It is spoken by over 10 million people and is the official language of the Czech Republic. [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:image </span> <div rel='schema:image' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009056102134' typeof='schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:MediaObject schema:ImageObject'> <span class='type'>schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:MediaObject schema:ImageObject</span> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:height </span> <a href='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000712794104161' property='schema:height'>https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000712794104161</a> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:url </span> <a href='https://twemoji.maxcdn.com/2/svg/1f1e8-1f1ff.svg' property='schema:url'>https://twemoji.maxcdn.com/2/svg/1f1e8-1f1ff.svg</a> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:width </span> <a href='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000712794104161' property='schema:width'>https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000712794104161</a> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:inLanguage </span> <div rel='schema:inLanguage' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009056104234' typeof='schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible schema:Language'> <span class='type'>schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible schema:Language</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>čeština</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:alternateName </span> <span property='schema:alternateName'>Czech language</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:identifier </span> <div rel='schema:identifier' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009056102534' typeof='schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:StructuredValue schema:Intangible schema:PropertyValue'> <span class='type'>schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:StructuredValue schema:Intangible schema:PropertyValue</span> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:propertyID </span> <ul> <li property='schema:propertyID'>ces </li> <li property='schema:propertyID'>cs</li> </ul> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:sameAs </span> <ul> <li> <a href='https://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/langcodes_name.php?code_ID=107' property='schema:sameAs'>https://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/langcodes_name.php?code_ID=107</a> </li> <li> <a href='https://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/langcodes_name.php?iso_639_1=cs' property='schema:sameAs'>https://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/langcodes_name.php?iso_639_1=cs</a> </li> </ul> resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009058101152' typeof='schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource'> <span class='type'>schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Slovak language [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:about </span> <div rel='schema:about' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009058102452' typeof='schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>slovenský jazyk</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>Slovenský / sloʊvæk, -vɑːk / (slovenský: Slovenčina jazyk, vyslovuje [sloʋenskiː jazik], alebo slovenčina [sloʋentʃina], nemožno zamieňať s Slovenskí Jezik alebo slovenščina, natívne názvy slovinského jazyka) je Indo-európsky jazyk, ktorý patrí medzi jazykmi západoslovanských (spolu s českých, poľských, sliezskych, Kashubian a Sorbian). Slovenskí je úradným jazykom na slovenskom, kde sa hovorí o cca 5,51 milióna ľudí (2014). Slovenskí reproduktory sa nachádzajú aj v Spojených štátoch, v Českej republike, Argentíne, Srbska, Írska, Rumunska, Poľska, Kanady, Maďarska, Chorvátska, Veľkej Británii, Austrálii, Rakúsku, na Ukrajine a mnoho ďalších po celom svete.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>slovenský jazyk</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:termCode </span> <span property='schema:termCode'>Q9058</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>Slovak is an Indo-European language that belongs to the West Slavic languages (together with Czech, Polish, Silesian, Kashubian, and Sorbian). [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:image </span> <div rel='schema:image' rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>magyar nyelv</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>Magyar a hivatalos nyelv a magyar és az egyik a 24 hivatalos nyelvén az Európai Unióban. Magyarországon kívül is beszélnek közösségek a magyar emberek a szomszédos országokban (különösen Romániában, Szlovákiában és Szerbiában), és a magyar diaszpóra közösségek világszerte. Mint finn és az észt, tartozik az uráli nyelvcsalád, a legközelebbi rokonai pedig manysi és hanti. Ez az egyik a számos európai nyelven nem része az indoeurópai nyelvek. A magyar nevet a nyelv magyar [mɒɟɒr] vagy magyar nyelv (). A „magyar” is használják, mint egy angol szó utal a magyar embereket, mint egy etnikai csoport, vagy a nyelvét.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>magyar nyelv</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:termCode </span> <span property='schema:termCode'>Q9067</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>Hungarian is the official language of Hungary and one of the 24 official languages of the European Union. href='https://m.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:EntityData/Q9067.json' property='schema:sameAs'>https://m.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:EntityData/Q9067.json</a> </li> <li> <a schema:supersededBy </span> <div rel='schema:supersededBy' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000034113109161' typeof='schema:Class schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:Class schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Uralic languages</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:mainEntityOfPage </span> <div rel='schema:mainEntityOfPage' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000034113101161' typeof='schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource'> <span class='type'>schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Uralic languages [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:about </span> <div rel='schema:about' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000034113102461' typeof='schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Uralic languages</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>The Uralic languages /jʊˈrælᵻk/ (sometimes called Uralian languages /jʊˈreɪliən/) constitute a language family of some 38 languages spoken by approximately 25 million people, predominantly in Northern Eurasia. The Uralic languages with the most native speakers are Hungarian, Finnish, and Estonian, which are official languages of Hungary, Finland, and Estonia, respectively, and of the European Union. Other Uralic languages with significant numbers of speakers are Erzya, Moksha, Mari, Udmurt, and Komi, which are officially recognized languages in various regions of Russia. The name &quot;Uralic&quot; derives from the fact that areas where the languages are spoken spread on both sides of the Ural Mountains. Also, the original homeland (Urheimat) is commonly hypothesized to lie in the vicinity of the Urals. Finno-Ugric is sometimes used as a synonym for Uralic, though Finno-Ugric is widely understood to exclude the Samoyedic languages. Scholars who do not accept the traditional notion that Samoyedic split first from the rest of the Uralic family, such as Tapani Salminen, may treat both terms as synonymous.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Uralic languages</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:termCode </span> <span property='schema:termCode'>Q34113</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>The Uralic languages constitute a language family of some 38 languages spoken by approximately 25 million people, predominantly in Northern Eurasia. [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:inLanguage </span> <a href='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000007976104261' property='schema:inLanguage'>https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000007976104261</a> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Uralic languages [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Uralic languages</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:sameAs </span> <ul> <li> <a href='http://dbpedia.org/page/Uralic_languages' property='schema:sameAs'>http://dbpedia.org/page/Uralic_languages</a> </li> <li> <a href='https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q34113' property='schema:sameAs'>https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q34113</a> </li> <li> <a href='https://m.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:EntityData/Q34113.json' property='schema:sameAs'>https://m.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:EntityData/Q34113.json</a> </li> </ul> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:supersededBy </span> <a href='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010020162172109161' property='schema:supersededBy'>https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010020162172109161</a> </div> </div> </div> </div> <div resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009168109161' typeof='schema:Class schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:Class schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Persian</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:mainEntityOfPage </span> <div rel='schema:mainEntityOfPage' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009168101147' typeof='schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource'> <span class='type'>schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Persian language [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:about </span> <div rel='schema:about' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009168102447' typeof='schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>فارسی</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>فارسی (/ pɜːrʒən / یا / pɜːrʃən /)، محلی به عنوان پارسی یا فارسی (فارسی فارسی [fɒːɾsiː])، از نسل مدرن غالب فارسی باستان، شناخته شده یکی از زبانهای ایرانی غربی در شعبه هند و ایرانی از Indo- است خانواده زبان های اروپایی است. این در درجه اول در ایران، افغانستان (رسما به عنوان دری از سال 1958 به دلایل سیاسی شناخته می شود)، و تاجیکستان (رسما به عنوان تاجیکی از دوران شوروی به دلایل سیاسی شناخته می شود)، و برخی مناطق دیگر که در طول تاریخ جوامع ایرانی بودند سخن گفته است. زبان فارسی را به عنوان یک ادامه فارسی میانه، زبان رسمی مذهبی و ادبی امپراتوری ساسانی، خود را ادامه قدیمی فارسی، زبان امپراتوری هخامنشی است. فارسی یک زبان pluricentric است و دستور زبان آن شبیه به بسیاری از زبانهای معاصر اروپا است. فارسی نام خود را از منشاء آن در پایتخت امپراطوری هخامنشی، پرسیس، مدرن روز استان فارس، از این رو نام فارسی (فارسی). یک فرد فارسی زبان ممکن است به عنوان پارسیگو اشاره شده است. حدود 110 میلیون فارسی زبان وجود دارد در سراسر جهان، با زبان برگزاری رسمی در ایران، افغانستان و تاجیکستان. برای قرن ها، فارسی نیز یک زبان فرهنگی معتبر در دیگر مناطق غربی آسیا، آسیای مرکزی و جنوب آسیا توسط امپراتوری های مختلف مستقر در مناطق بوده است. فارسی است (به طور عمده لغوی) نفوذ قابل توجهی در زبانهای همسایه، به ویژه به زبان های ترکی در آسیای مرکزی، قفقاز و آناتولی، زبانهای ایرانی همسایه، و همچنین ارمنستان، گرجستان، و زبانهای هندوآریایی، به خصوص اردو بود. همچنین برخی از نفوذ در عربی، به ویژه عربی بحرانی اعمال، در حالی که وام گرفتن واژگان زیادی از آن را پس از حمله اعراب به ایران. با سابقه ای طولانی از ادبیات در قالب فارسی میانه قبل از اسلام، فارسی بود زبان اول در جهان اسلام به انحصار عربی شکستن در نوشتن، و در نوشتن شعر به زبان فارسی به عنوان یک سنت دادگاه در بسیاری از دادگاه شرقی تاسیس شد. برخی از آثار معروف ادبیات فارسی است شاهنامه فردوسی، آثار مولوی، رباعیات عمر خیام، دیوان حافظ و دو متفرقه از نظم و نثر توسط سعدی شیرازی، گلستان &quot;باغ رز&quot; و بوستان &quot;باغ&quot; (به معنای واقعی کلمه &quot;محل عطر&quot;).</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>فارسی</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:termCode </span> <span property='schema:termCode'>Q9168</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>Persian is one of the Western Iranian languages within the Indo-Iranian branch of the Indo-European language family. schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>한국어 (한국어 / 조선말 참조) 각 민족 국가에서 사용되는 다른 공식 형태의 대한민국과 조선 민주주의 인민 공화국의 공식 언어이다; 또한 중국의 인민 공화국의 연변 조선족 자치주와 창 바이 조선족 자치현에있는 두 개의 공식 언어 중 하나입니다. 약 80 만 명이 전 세계적으로 한국어 구사합니다. 한국어는 함께 한국어와 자체가 Koreanic 어족을 형성 몇 멸종 친척을 가지고 있습니다. 그럼에도 불구하고, 역사 언어학은 언어의 분리로 한국어 분류합니다. 한국어는 추정 알타이 어족에 속하는 아이디어는 일반적으로 불신하고있다. 여전히 한국과 일본이 언어 관련 여부에이 논의된다. 한국의 언어는 문법에서의 형태와 SOV에서 교착이다.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>한국어</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> <span class='label'> schema:about </span> <div rel='schema:about' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010011263525102461' typeof='schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Koreanic languages</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>The Koreanic languages are a language family consisting of the modern Korean language together with extinct ancient relatives closer to it than to any proposed links with Mongolic, Turkic, Tungusic, or Japanese. Among extant languages, Korean is considered by most linguists to be a language isolate, and by others as part of the widely disputed Altaic family. The Jeju language of Jeju Island, considered by some as a dialect of modern Korean, is distinct enough to be considered a language in its own right by other authorities. Some consider that rather than being a language isolate, Korean forms a small language family together with Jeju.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Koreanic languages</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:termCode </span> <span property='schema:termCode'>Q11263525</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>The Koreanic languages are a language family consisting of the modern Korean language. [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:inLanguage </span> <a href='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000007976104261' languages [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Koreanic languages</span> property='rdfs:label'>Vietnamese language [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:about </span> <div rel='schema:about' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009199102459' typeof='schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Tiếng Việt</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>Việt / ˌviɛtnəmiːz / (tiếng Việt) là một ngữ hệ Nam Á có nguồn gốc ở phía bắc của Việt Nam và là ngôn ngữ quốc gia và chính thức của đất nước. Đây là ngôn ngữ mẹ đẻ của người Việt (người Kinh), cũng như một ngôn ngữ thứ nhất hoặc thứ hai cho các dân tộc thiểu số nhiều của Việt Nam. Theo kết quả của di cư Việt Nam và ảnh hưởng văn hóa, loa Việt được tìm thấy trên khắp thế giới, đặc biệt là trong khu vực Đông và Đông Nam Á, Bắc Mỹ, Úc và Tây Âu. Việt cũng đã được chính thức công nhận là một ngôn ngữ dân tộc thiểu số tại Cộng hòa Séc. Nó là một phần của ngữ hệ Nam Á trong đó nó có cho đến nay hầu hết các diễn giả (nhiều lần như nhiều như Ngữ hệ Nam Á khác cộng lại). từ vựng tiếng Việt có Vay từ Trung Quốc, và nó trước đây là sử dụng một bộ sửa đổi của chữ Hán gọi là Nôm chữ được phát âm tiếng địa phương. Bảng chữ cái tiếng Việt (quốc ngữ) sử dụng ngày nay là một bảng chữ cái Latin với dấu bổ sung cho tông màu và một số thư.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Tiếng Việt</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:termCode </span> <span property='schema:termCode'>Q9199</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>Vietnamese is an Austroasiatic language that originated in the north of Vietnam and is the national and official language of the country. [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:image </span> <div rel='schema:image' property='schema:sameAs'>https://m.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:EntityData/Q9199.json</a> </li> <li> <a href='https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q9199' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000033199109161' typeof='schema:Class schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:Class schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Austro-Asiatic languages</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:mainEntityOfPage </span> <div rel='schema:mainEntityOfPage' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000033199101161' typeof='schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource'> <span class='type'>schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Austroasiatic languages [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:about </span> <div rel='schema:about' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000033199102461' typeof='schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Austroasiatic languages</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>The Austroasiatic languages, in recent classifications synonymous with Mon–Khmer, are a large language family of continental Southeast Asia, also scattered throughout India, Bangladesh, Nepal and the southern border of China. The name Austroasiatic comes from the Latin words for &quot;south&quot; and &quot;Asia&quot;, hence &quot;South Asia&quot;. Of these languages, only Vietnamese, Khmer, and Mon have a long-established recorded history, and only Vietnamese and Khmer have official status as modern national languages (in Vietnam and Cambodia, respectively). In the state level, Khasi has the official status in Meghalaya while Santali and Mundari are the two official languages of Jharkhand. In Myanmar, Wa language is de facto language of Wa State. The rest of the languages are spoken by minority groups and have no official status. Ethnologue identifies 168 Austroasiatic languages. These form thirteen established families (plus perhaps Shompen, which is poorly attested, as a fourteenth), which have traditionally been grouped into two, as Mon–Khmer and Munda. However, one recent classification posits three groups (Munda, Nuclear Mon-Khmer and Khasi–Khmuic) while another has abandoned Mon–Khmer as a taxon altogether, making it synonymous with the larger family. Austroasiatic languages have a disjunct distribution across India, Bangladesh, Nepal and Southeast Asia, separated by regions where other languages are spoken. They appear to be the autochthonous languages of Southeast Asia, with the neighboring Indo-Aryan, Tai–Kadai, Dravidian, Austronesian, and Sino-Tibetan languages being the result of later migrations.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Austroasiatic languages</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:termCode </span> <span property='schema:termCode'>Q33199</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>The Austroasiatic languages are a large language family of continental Southeast Asia, also scattered throughout India, Bangladesh, Nepal and the southern border of China. [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:inLanguage </span> <a href='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000007976104261' property='schema:inLanguage'>https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000007976104261</a> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Austroasiatic languages [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Austro-Asiatic languages</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:sameAs </span> <ul> <li> <a href='https://m.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:EntityData/Q33199.json' property='schema:sameAs'>https://m.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:EntityData/Q33199.json</a> </li> <li> <a href='https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q33199' property='schema:sameAs'>https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q33199</a> </li> <li> <a href='http://dbpedia.org/page/Austroasiatic_languages' property='schema:sameAs'>http://dbpedia.org/page/Austroasiatic_languages</a> </li> </ul> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:supersededBy </span> <a href='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010020162172109161' property='schema:supersededBy'>https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010020162172109161</a> </div> </div> </div> </div> <div resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009205109161' typeof='schema:Class schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:Class schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Khmer</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:mainEntityOfPage </span> <div rel='schema:mainEntityOfPage' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009205101143' typeof='schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource'> <span class='type'>schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Khmer language [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:about </span> <div rel='schema:about' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009205102443' typeof='schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>ភាសាខ្មែរ</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>ខ្មែរ / kmɛər / ឬកម្ពុជា (ដើមភាសាខ្មែរ [pʰiːəsaːkʰmaːe] ឬច្រើនជាងនេះជាផ្លូវការខេមរភាសា [kʰeɛmaʔraʔpʰiːəsaː]) គឺជាភាសានៃប្រជាជនខ្មែរនិងជាភាសាជាផ្លូវការនៃប្រទេសកម្ពុជា។ ប្រមាណ 16 លានវាគ្មិន, វាគឺជាការនិយាយយ៉ាងទូលំទូលាយជាភាសាទក្សិណអាស៊ីបំផុតទីពីរ (បន្ទាប់ពីប្រទេសវៀតណាម) ។ ភាសាខ្មែរត្រូវបានមានឥទ្ធិពលគួរឱ្យកត់សម្គាល់ដោយសំស្រ្កឹតនិងភាសាបាលីជាពិសេសក្នុងបញ្ជីរាជវង្សនិងសាសនាតាមរយៈសាសនាហិណ្ឌូនិងព្រះពុទ្ធសាសនា។ នេះជាបញ្ជីសាមញ្ញកាន់តែច្រើនមានឥទ្ធិពលនិងត្រូវបានរងឥទ្ធិពលដោយថៃឡាវវៀតណាមនិងចាមដែលទាំងអស់នេះដោយសារតែជិតភូមិសាស្រ្តនិងទំនាក់ទំនងវប្បធម៍រយៈពេលវែងបង្កើតបាន sprachbund នៅតំបន់អាស៊ីអាគ្នេយ៍ឧបទ្វីបមួយ។ វាគឺជាភាសាដែលបានសរសេរដែលបានកត់ត្រាទុកដំបូងបំផុតនិងដំបូងបំផុតនៃគ្រួសារមនខ្មែរ predating មននិងដោយរឹមយ៉ាងសំខាន់របស់វៀតណាមដោយសារតែចាស់ខ្មែរត្រូវបានភាសារបស់ចក្រភពប្រវត្តិសាស្រ្តនៃចេនឡាអង្គរនិង, សន្មត, រដ្ឋមុនរបស់មុនរបស់ពួកគេ, ភ្វូណន។ ភាគច្រើននៃវាគ្មិនខ្មែរនិយាយកណ្តាលខ្មែរគ្រាមភាសានៃធម្មតាកណ្តាលដែលជាកន្លែងដែលខ្មែរត្រូវបានប្រមូលផ្តុំយ៉ាងខ្លាំងបំផុត។ នៅប្រទេសកម្ពុជាមាននៅក្នុងតំបន់សង្កត់សំឡេងដាច់ស្រយាលប៉ុន្តែទាំងនេះតំបន់នេះត្រូវបានចាត់ទុកថាជាពូជនៃកណ្តាលខ្មែរ។ ករណីលើកលែងពីរគឺការបញ្ចេញមតិរបស់រាជធានីភ្នំពេញហើយថារបស់ខ្មែរ Khe ក្នុងខេត្តស្ទឹងត្រែងទាំងពីរដែលខុសគ្នាគ្រប់គ្រាន់គ្រប់គ្រាន់ពីកណ្តាលខ្មែរត្រូវបានចាត់ទុកគ្រាមភាសាដាច់ដោយឡែករបស់ខ្មែរ។ នៅខាងក្រៅនៃប្រទេសកម្ពុជាគ្រាមភាសាបីផ្សេងគ្នាគឺត្រូវបាននិយាយដោយជនជាតិខ្មែរមានដើមកំណើតទៅកាន់តំបន់ដែលមានប្រវត្តិសាស្រ្តផ្នែកមួយនៃអាណាចក្រខ្មែរ។ ភាសាភាគខាងជើងភាសាខ្មែរត្រូវបាននិយាយដោយជនជាតិខ្មែរជាងមួយលាននាក់ក្នុងតំបន់ភាគខាងត្បូងនៃភាគឦសានប្រទេសថៃហើយត្រូវបានព្យាបាលដោយភាសាវិទូមួយចំនួនជាភាសាដាច់ដោយឡែកមួយ។ ខ្មែរក្រោមឬខ្មែរភាគខាងត្បូងគឺជាភាសាដំបូងនៃខ្មែរខ្មែរវៀតណាមខណៈពេលដែលរស់នៅក្នុងជួរភ្នំក្រវាញពីចម្ងាយដែលនិយាយភាសាអភិរក្សណាស់ដែលថានៅតែបង្ហាញលក្ខណៈពិសេសនៃភាសាជ្ឈឹមខ្មែរ។ ខ្មែរជាចម្បងវិភាគមួយញែកភាសា។ មិនមានការផ្លាស់ប្តូគូឬករណីចុងមាន។ ផ្ទុយទៅវិញ, ភាគល្អិតនិងពាក្យជំនួយត្រូវបានប្រើដើម្បីបង្ហាញទំនាក់ទំនងវេយ្យាករណ៍។ លំដាប់ពាក្យទូទៅគឺជាប្រធានបទ-កិរិយាសព្ទវត្ថុនិងការកែប្រែតាមពាក្យដែលពួកគេបានកែប្រែ។ ការផ្សព្វផ្សាយចំរុះបង្ហាញបន្ទាប់ពីលេខដែលនៅពេលដែលប្រើដើម្បីរាប់នាមទោះបីជាមិនមែនតែងតែដូច្នេះបានយ៉ាងប្រាកដដូចជានៅក្នុងភាសាដូចជាចិន។ នៅក្នុងភាសាខ្មែរនិយាយរចនាសម្ព័ន្ធប្រធានបទ-ការបំភ្លឺបានទេគឺជារឿងធម្មតានិងការទំនាក់ទំនងក្នុងសង្គមបានដឹងថានេះអ្នកចូលរួមកំណត់ចន្លោះពីកំណត់នៃវាក្យស័ព្ទដូចជាសព្វនាមនិងកិត្តិយសគឺត្រឹមត្រូវ។ ខ្មែរខុសពីភាសាប្រទេសជិតខាងដូចជាថៃ, ភូមា, ឡាវនិងវៀតណាមនៅក្នុងនោះវាមិនមែនជាភាសាដែលសំនៀង។ ពាក្យដែលត្រូវបានគេបានសង្កត់ធ្ងន់នៅលើគ្រចុងក្រោយ, ហេតុនេះពាក្យជាច្រើនអនុលោមតាមលំនាំខ្មែរមនព្យាង្គសង្កត់ធ្ងន់ពីធម្មតាមួយដែលបានបន្តដោយការព្យាង្គអនីតិជន។ ភាសានេះត្រូវបានសរសេរក្នុងអក្សរខ្មែរអាប៊ុហ៊្គីដាចុះពីស្គ្រីប Brahmi បានតាមរយៈអក្សរបល្លវៈឥណ្ឌាភាគខាងត្បូងចាប់តាំងពីយ៉ាងហោចណាស់សតវត្សទីប្រាំពីរ។ ទម្រង់បែបបទស្គ្រីបនិងការប្រើប្រាស់មានការវិវត្តលើសតវត្ស; លក្ខណៈពិសេសរួមមាន subscripted ទំនើបរបស់ខ្លួនកំណែព្យញ្ជនៈបានប្រើដើម្បីសរសេរចង្កោមនិងផ្នែកមួយនៃព្យញ្ជនៈចូលទៅក្នុងស៊េរីពីរនាក់ជាមួយស្រៈមានជាប់ផ្សេងគ្នា។ ប្រមាណ 79% នៃប្រជាជនកម្ពុជាអាចអានខ្មែរ។</span> </div> <div class='property'> rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible schema:Language'> <span class='type'>schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible schema:Language</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>ភាសាខ្មែរ</h1> <div class='property'> schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:Class schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Lao</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:mainEntityOfPage </span> <div rel='schema:mainEntityOfPage' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009211101145' typeof='schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource'> <span class='type'>schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Lao language [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:about </span> <div rel='schema:about' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009211102445' typeof='schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>ພາສາລາວ</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>ລາວ, ຍັງເອີ້ນວ່າລາວ, (ລາວ &#39;ລາວ&#39; ຫຼືພາສາລາວ &#39;ລາວພາສາ&#39;) ເປັນພາສາວັນນະຍຸກຂອງພາສາຕະກູນໄຕກະໄດ. ມັນເປັນພາສາທາງການຂອງລາວ, ແລະຍັງເວົ້າໃນພາກເຫນອຂອງປະເທດໄທ, ບ່ອນທີ່ມັນປົກກະຕິແລ້ວຈະເອີ້ນວ່າພາສາອີສານ. ພາສາລາວເຮັດຫນ້າທີ່ເປັນ franca lingua ສໍາຄັນເປັນປະເທດຂອງລາວໄດ້ປະກອບດ້ວຍບັນດາເຜົ່າທີ່ຫຼາກຫຼາຍ, ປະຊາກອນຕໍາເວົ້າກ່ຽວກັບ 86 ພາສາທີ່ແຕກຕ່າງກັນ. ເວົ້າລາວກັນແລະກັນກັບພາສາໄທ (ທັງສອງພາສາແມ່ນລາຍລັກອັກສອນທີ່ມີສະຄິບທີ່ແຕກຕ່າງກັນເລັກນ້ອຍແຕ່ມີຄວາມຄ້າຍຄືກັນພາສາ). ລາວ, ເຊັ່ນ: ຈໍານວນຫຼາຍພາສາໃນລາວ, ແມ່ນລາຍລັກອັກສອນໃນ script ລາວ, ເປັນ abugida. ເຖິງແມ່ນວ່າບໍ່ມີມາດຕະຖານຢ່າງເປັນທາງການ, ທັງຮູ້ພາສາວຽງຈັນໄດ້ກາຍເປັນມາດຕະຖານ de facto.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>ພາສາລາວ</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:termCode </span> <span property='schema:termCode'>Q9211</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>Lao is a tonal language of the Tai-Kadai language family. [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:image </span> <div rel='schema:image' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009211102145' typeof='schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:MediaObject schema:ImageObject'> <span class='type'>schema:CreativeWork </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:supersededBy </span> <div rel='schema:supersededBy' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000034171109161' typeof='schema:Class schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:Class schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Kra-Dai languages</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:mainEntityOfPage </span> <div rel='schema:mainEntityOfPage' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000034171101161' typeof='schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource'> <span class='type'>schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Kra-Dai languages [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:about </span> <div rel='schema:about' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000034171102461' typeof='schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Kra-Dai languages</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>The Tai–Kadai languages, also known as Kra–Dai, Daic, and Kadai are a language family of highly tonal languages found in southern China, northeast India and Southeast Asia. They include Thai and Lao, the national languages of Thailand and Laos respectively. There are nearly 100 million speakers of these languages in the world. Ethnologue lists 95 languages in this family, with 62 of these being in the Tai branch. The diversity of the Tai–Kadai languages in southeastern China, especially in Guizhou and Hainan, suggests that this is close to their homeland. The Tai branch moved south into Southeast Asia only about a thousand years ago, founding the nations that later became Thailand and Laos in what had been Austroasiatic territory. The name &quot;Tai–Kadai&quot; is controversial, and arguments have been made that it should be replaced. The name comes from an obsolete bifurcation of the family into two branches, Tai and Kadai (all else). Yet the name Kadai suggests that it includes Tai, and as such is sometimes used to refer to the entire family. On the other hand, some references restrict the usage of &quot;Kadai&quot; to the Kra branch of the family, for which the name Kra suffices. The replacement name Kra–Dai has been suggested, as Kra and Dai are two large and well-established subgroups that are on different sides of a major historical split. The name Kra–Dai has since been adopted in several major scholarly works on the family.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Kra-Dai languages</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:termCode </span> <span property='schema:termCode'>Q34171</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>The Tai-Kadai languages are a language family of highly tonal languages found in southern China, northeast India and Southeast Asia. [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:inLanguage </span> <a href='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000007976104261' property='schema:inLanguage'>https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000007976104261</a> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Kra-Dai languages [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Kra-Dai languages</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:sameAs </span> <ul> <li> <a href='https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q34171' property='schema:sameAs'>https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q34171</a> </li> <li> <a href='https://m.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:EntityData/Q34171.json' property='schema:sameAs'>https://m.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:EntityData/Q34171.json</a> </li> <li> <a href='http://dbpedia.org/page/Kra-Dai_languages' property='schema:sameAs'>http://dbpedia.org/page/Kra-Dai_languages</a> </li> </ul> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009217102456' typeof='schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>ภาษาไทย</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>ไทยยังเป็นที่รู้จักสยามหรือเซ็นทรัลไทยเป็นภาษาประจำชาติและอย่างเป็นทางการของไทยและภาษาพื้นเมืองของคนไทยและส่วนใหญ่ของชาวไทยเชื้อสายจีน ไทยเป็นสมาชิกของกลุ่มไทของตระกูลภาษาไท Kadai กว่าครึ่งหนึ่งของคำในภาษาไทยที่ยืมมาจากภาษาบาลีสันสกฤตและเก่าเขมร มันเป็นภาษาวรรณยุกต์และการวิเคราะห์ ไทยยังมีการันต์ที่ซับซ้อนและเครื่องหมายเชิงสัมพันธ์ พูดไทยร่วมกันกับลาว (ภาษาลาวสองภาษาเขียนด้วยสคริปต์ที่แตกต่างกันเล็กน้อย แต่มีความคล้ายคลึงภาษา)</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:Class schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Burmese</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:mainEntityOfPage </span> <div rel='schema:mainEntityOfPage' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009228101132' typeof='schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource'> <span class='type'>schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Burmese language [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:about </span> <div rel='schema:about' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009228102432' typeof='schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'> မြန်မာဘာသာစကား</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>မြန်မာဘာသာစကား (မြန်မာဘာသာ, MLCTS: မြန်မာ့လေကြောင်း bhasa [mjəmà bada]) မြန်မာနိုင်ငံ၏ရုံးသုံးဘာသာစကားသည်။ မြန်မာနိုင်ငံတော်ဖွဲ့စည်းပုံအခြေခံဥပဒေတရားဝင်မြန်မာဘာသာစကားအဖြစ်ဘာသာစကား၏အင်္ဂလိပ်အမည်အားအသိအမှတ်ပြုပေမယ့်အများစုအင်္ဂလိပ်စပီကာမြန်မာအဖြစ်ဘာသာစကားကိုရည်ညွှန်းဖို့ဆက်လက်။ 2007 ခုနှစ်တွင်ကအဓိကဗမာ (ဗမာလူမြိုး) လူများနှင့်ဆက်စပ်တိုင်းရင်းသားအဖွဲ့ 33 သန်းအားဖြင့်တစ်ဦးပထမဦးဆုံးဘာသာစကားအဖြစ်ပြောပြီနှင့် 10 သန်းအားဖြင့်တစ်စက္ကန့်ဘာသာစကား, မြန်မာနိုင်ငံတွင်အထူးသဖြင့်တိုင်းရင်းသားလူနည်းစုများနှင့်အိမ်နီးချင်းနိုင်ငံများအဖြစ်ခဲ့သည်။ မြန်မာတစ်ဦး tonal, အစေး-မှတ်ပုံတင်ရန်နှင့်ဘာသာရပ်-object-ကြိယာစကားလုံးအမိန့်နှင့်အတူအဓိကအား monosyllabic နှင့်သရုပ်ခွဲ syllable-အချိန်ကုန်ဆုံးဘာသာစကား, ဖြစ်ပါတယ်။ ဒါဟာတရုတ်-တိဘက်ဘာသာစကားကမိသားစုများ၏ Lolo ဗမာအုပ်စုအဖွဲ့ဝင်တစ်ဦးဖြစ်ပါတယ်။ မြန်မာအက္ခရာနောက်ဆုံးမှာတစ် Brahmic ဇာတ်ညွှန်း, Kadamba သို့မဟုတ် Pallava ဖြစ်စေထံမှဆင်းသက်တော်မူသည်။</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'> မြန်မာဘာသာစကား</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:termCode </span> <span property='schema:termCode'>Q9228</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Sino-Tibetan languages</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:mainEntityOfPage </span> <div rel='schema:mainEntityOfPage' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000045961101161' typeof='schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource'> <span class='type'>schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Sino-Tibetan languages [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:about </span> <div rel='schema:about' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000045961102461' typeof='schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Sino-Tibetan languages</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>The Sino-Tibetan languages, in a few sources also known as Tibeto-Burman or Trans-Himalayan, are a family of more than 400 languages spoken in East Asia, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The family is second only to the Indo-European languages in terms of the number of native speakers. The Sino-Tibetan languages with the most native speakers are the varieties of Chinese (1.2 billion speakers), Burmese (33 million) and the Tibetic languages (8 million). Many Sino-Tibetan languages are spoken by small communities in remote mountain areas and are poorly documented. Several low-level groupings are well established, but the higher-level structure of the family remains unclear. Although the family is often presented as divided into Sinitic and Tibeto-Burman branches, a common origin of the non-Sinitic languages has never been demonstrated, and is rejected by an increasing number of researchers.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Sino-Tibetan languages</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:termCode </span> <span property='schema:termCode'>Q45961</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>The Sino-Tibetan languages are a family of more than 400 languages spoken in East Asia, Southeast Asia and South Asia. [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:inLanguage </span> <a href='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000007976104261' property='schema:inLanguage'>https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000007976104261</a> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Sino-Tibetan languages [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Sino-Tibetan languages</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:sameAs </span> <ul> <li> <a href='https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q45961' property='schema:sameAs'>https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q45961</a> </li> <li> <a href='http://dbpedia.org/page/Sino-Tibetan_languages' property='schema:sameAs'>http://dbpedia.org/page/Sino-Tibetan_languages</a> </li> <li> <a href='https://m.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:EntityData/Q45961.json' property='schema:sameAs'>https://m.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:EntityData/Q45961.json</a> </li> </ul> </div> <div class='property'> typeof='schema:Class schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:Class schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Malay</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:mainEntityOfPage </span> <div rel='schema:mainEntityOfPage' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009237101146' typeof='schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource'> <span class='type'>schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Malay language [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:about </span> <div rel='schema:about' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009237102446' typeof='schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>بهاس ملايو</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>Melayu (/ məleɪ /; Bahasa Malaysia: Bahasa Melayu; Jawi abjad: بهاس ملايو) adalah bahasa utama dalam keluarga Austronesia. Ia mempunyai status rasmi di Brunei, Indonesia, Malaysia, dan Singapura. Ia dituturkan oleh 270 juta orang di seluruh Selat Melaka, termasuk pantai Semenanjung Tanah Melayu Malaysia dan pantai timur Sumatera di Indonesia, dan telah ditubuhkan sebagai bahasa berasal dari bahagian barat pantai Sarawak dan Kalimantan Barat di Borneo . Sebagai Bahasa Kebangsaan atau Bahasa Nasional (National Language) di beberapa negeri, Standard Melayu mempunyai pelbagai nama rasmi. Di Singapura dan Brunei ia dipanggil Bahasa Melayu (Bahasa Melayu); di Malaysia, Bahasa Malaysia (bahasa Malaysia); dan di Indonesia, Bahasa Indonesia (bahasa Indonesia) dan ditetapkan dalam Bahasa Persatuan / Pemersatu ( &quot;bahasa penyatu / lingua franca&quot;). Walau bagaimanapun, di kawasan tengah ke selatan Sumatra di mana bahasa adalah asli, Indonesia merujuk kepadanya sebagai Bahasa Melayu dan menganggap ia salah satu bahasa serantau mereka. Standard Malay, juga dikenali sebagai Mahkamah Melayu, adalah standard sastera pra-kolonial Melaka dan Johor Kesultanan, dan bahasa yang kadang-kadang dipanggil Melaka, Johor, atau Riau Melayu (atau pelbagai kombinasi nama-nama) untuk membezakannya daripada pelbagai bahasa Malayan lain. Menurut Ethnologue 16, beberapa jenis Malayan mereka kini senarai sebagai bahasa berasingan, termasuk jenis Orang Asli Semenanjung Melayu, berkaitan rapat dengan standard Melayu bahawa mereka boleh membuktikan untuk menjadi dialek. (Ini disenaraikan dengan tanda tanya dalam Infobox di sebelah kanan atau di atas (bergantung kepada peranti).) Terdapat juga beberapa bahasa perdagangan dan bahasa campuran Melayu yang berdasarkan lingua franca berasal dari klasik Melayu, serta Macassar Melayu yang nampaknya menjadi bahasa campuran.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>بهاس ملايو</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:termCode </span> <span property='schema:termCode'>Q9237</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>Malay is a major language of the Austronesian family. It has an official status in Brunei, Indonesia, Malaysia, and Singapore. [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:image </span> <div rel='schema:image' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000009237102146' typeof='schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:MediaObject schema:ImageObject'> <span class='type'>schema:CreativeWork class='label'> schema:width </span> <a href='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000712794104161' property='schema:width'>https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000712794104161</a> </div> </div> <a href='https://m.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:EntityData/Q9237.json' property='schema:sameAs'>https://m.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:EntityData/Q9237.json</a> </li> <li> <a href='https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q9237' property='schema:sameAs'>https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q9237</a> </li> </ul> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:supersededBy </span> <div rel='schema:supersededBy' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000049228109161' typeof='schema:Class schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:Class schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Austronesian languages</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:mainEntityOfPage </span> <div rel='schema:mainEntityOfPage' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000049228101161' typeof='schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource'> <span class='type'>schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Austronesian languages [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:about </span> <div rel='schema:about' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000049228102461' typeof='schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Austronesian languages</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>The Austronesian languages are a language family that is widely dispersed throughout Maritime Southeast Asia, Madagascar and the islands of the Pacific Ocean, with a few members on continental Asia. Austronesian languages are spoken by about 386 million people, making it the fifth-largest language family by number of speakers, behind only the Indo-European languages, the Sino-Tibetan languages, the Niger-Congo languages, and the Afroasiatic languages. It is on par with Indo-European, Niger–Congo, and Afroasiatic as one of the best-established language families. Major Austronesian languages with the highest number of speakers are Malay (Indonesian and Malaysian), Javanese, and Filipino (Tagalog). Otto Dempwolff was the first researcher to extensively explore Austronesian using the comparative method. Another German, Wilhelm Schmidt, coined the German word austronesisch which comes from Latin auster &quot;south wind&quot; plus Greek nêsos &quot;island&quot;. The name Austronesian was formed from the same roots. The family is aptly named, as the vast majority of Austronesian languages are spoken on islands: only a few languages, such as Malay and the Chamic languages, are indigenous to mainland Asia. Many Austronesian languages have very few speakers, but the major Austronesian languages are spoken by tens of millions of people and one Austronesian language, Malay, is spoken by 250 million people, making it the 8th most spoken language in the world. Twenty or so Austronesian languages are official in their respective countries (see the list of major and official Austronesian languages). Different sources count languages differently, but Austronesian and Niger–Congo are the two largest language families in the world, each having roughly one-fifth of the total languages counted in the world. The geographical span of Austronesian was the largest of any language family before the spread of Indo-European in the colonial period, ranging from Madagascar off the southeastern coast of Africa to Easter Island in the eastern Pacific. Hawaiian, Rapa Nui, and Malagasy (spoken on Madagascar) are the geographic outliers of the Austronesian family. According to Robert Blust (1999), Austronesian is divided in several primary branches, all but one of which are found exclusively on Taiwan. The Formosan languages of Taiwan are grouped into as many as nine first-order subgroups of Austronesian. All Austronesian languages spoken outside Taiwan (including its offshore Yami language) belong to the Malayo-Polynesian branch, sometimes called Extra-Formosan. Most Austronesian languages lack a long history of written attestation, making the feat of reconstructing earlier stages – up to distant Proto-Austronesian – all the more remarkable. The oldest inscription in the Cham language, the Đông Yên Châu inscription, dated to the mid-6th century at the latest, is also the first attestation of any Austronesian language.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Austronesian languages</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:termCode </span> <span property='schema:termCode'>Q49228</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>The Austronesian languages are a language family that is widely dispersed throughout Maritime Southeast Asia, Madagascar and the islands of the Pacific Ocean. [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:inLanguage </span> <a href='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000007976104261' property='schema:inLanguage'>https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000007976104261</a> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Austronesian languages [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Austronesian languages</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:sameAs </span> <ul> <li> <a href='https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q49228' property='schema:sameAs'>https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q49228</a> </li> <li> <a href='https://m.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:EntityData/Q49228.json' property='schema:sameAs'>https://m.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:EntityData/Q49228.json</a> </li> <li> <a href='http://dbpedia.org/page/Austronesian_languages' property='schema:sameAs'>http://dbpedia.org/page/Austronesian_languages</a> </li> </ul> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:supersededBy </span> <a href='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010020162172109161' property='schema:supersededBy'>https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010020162172109161</a> </div> </div> </div> </div> <div resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000013955109161' typeof='schema:Class schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:Class schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Arabic</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:mainEntityOfPage </span> <div rel='schema:mainEntityOfPage' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000013955101131' typeof='schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource'> <span class='type'>schema:CreativeWork schema:Thing rdfs:Resource</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>Arabic [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:about </span> <div rel='schema:about' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000013955102431' typeof='schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible'> <span class='type'>schema:DefinedTerm schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>العربية</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>العربية (العربية: العربية، آل&#39;arabiyyah [ʔalʕarabijːah] أو العربية: عربي&#39;arabiyy [ʕarabijː]) هي اللغة العربية الكلاسيكية من 6th قرن وأحفاد الحديثة، باستثناء المالطية. يتحدث العربية في قوس واسع يمتد عبر غرب آسيا وشمال أفريقيا والقرن الأفريقي. ينتمي العربية إلى فرع سامية من عائلة Afroasiatic. اللغة الأدبية، ودعا اللغة العربية الفصحى الحديثة أو الأدبية العربية، هو الشكل الرسمي الوحيد للغة العربية. يتم استخدامه في أكثر الوثائق المكتوبة وكذلك في مناسبات تحدث الرسمية، مثل المحاضرات ونشرات الأخبار. بعض أصناف تحدث هي غير مفهومة بشكل متبادل، سواء المكتوبة وشفويا، وأصناف ككل تشكل اللغة الاجتماعي اللغوي. وهذا يعني أن على أسس لغوية بحتة أنها من المرجح أن يرى أنها تشكل أكثر من لغة واحدة، ولكن عادة تجميعها معا كلغة واحدة لأسباب سياسية أو دينية (). وإذا اعتبر العربية لغة واحدة، وربما تحدث من قبل ما لا يقل عن 422 مليون المتحدثين (الأصلي وغير الأصلي) في العالم العربي، مما يجعلها واحدة من أكثر اللغات الست في العالم. إذا اعتبر غات مستقلة، فإن متنوعة الأكثر استعمالا، من المرجح أن تكون مصر العربية ب 89 مليون ناطق لا تزال الأصلي أكبر من أي لغة أخرى Afroasiatic. العربية هي أيضا لغة طقسية 1.6 مليار مسلم. انها واحدة من اللغات الرسمية الست للأمم المتحدة. مشتق من اللغة المكتوبة الحديثة (اللغة العربية الفصحى الحديثة) من لغة القرآن (المعروف العربية الكلاسيكية أو القرآنية العربية). تدرس على نطاق واسع في المدارس والجامعات، ويستخدم بدرجات متفاوتة في أماكن العمل، والحكومة، ووسائل الإعلام. يتم تجميع أصناف رسمية الاثنين معا كما الأدبية العربية، والتي هي اللغة الرسمية في 26 ولاية واللغة الليتورجية للإسلام. اللغة العربية الفصحى الحديثة يلي إلى حد كبير المعايير النحوية القرآني العربية ويستخدم الكثير من نفس المفردات. ومع ذلك، فقد تجاهلها بعض الانشاءات النحوية والمفردات التي لم يعد لدينا أي نظيره في أصناف تحدث، وتبنت بعض الإنشاءات الجديدة والمفردات من أصناف تحدث. يستخدم الكثير من المفردات الجديدة للدلالة المفاهيم التي نشأت في حقبة ما بعد القرآني، وخاصة في العصر الحديث. هو مكتوب باللغة العربية مع الأبجدية العربية، وهو السيناريو ابجد ويكتب من اليمين إلى اليسار على الرغم من أن أصناف تحدث مكتوبة أحيانا في ASCII اللاتينية من اليسار إلى اليمين مع عدم وجود استمارات موحدة. أثرت العربية العديد من اللغات في جميع أنحاء العالم طوال تاريخها. بعض اللغات الاكثر تأثرا هي الفارسية والتركية والأردية والكردية والبوسنية، الكازاخية، البنغالية، الهندية والماليزية والمالديف والإندونيسية والبشتو، البنجابية، التاغالوغ، السندية والهوسا وبعض اللغات في أجزاء من أفريقيا. خلال العصور الوسطى، كان الأدبية العربية وسيلة رئيسية للثقافة في أوروبا، وخاصة في العلوم والرياضيات والفلسفة. ونتيجة لذلك، فقد اقترضت العديد من اللغات الأوروبية أيضا العديد من الكلمات منها. تم العثور على العديد من الكلمات من أصل عربي أيضا في اللغات القديمة مثل اللاتينية واليونانية. تأثير اللغة العربية، وخاصة في المفردات، وينظر في اللغات الأوروبية، وذلك أساسا الإسبانية والبرتغالية بسبب كل من القرب من الحضارات العربية الأوروبية والإسلامية المسيحية و 800 سنة من الثقافة العربية واللغة في شبه الجزيرة الايبيرية، المشار إليها في اللغة العربية الأندلس . وقد اكتسبت لغات البلقان، بما في ذلك اليونانية، كما أن عددا كبيرا من المفردات العربية من خلال الاتصال مع التركية العثمانية. اقترضت العربية أيضا كلمات من لغات عديدة، بما في ذلك العبرية والآرامية واليونانية والفارسية والسريانية في القرون الأولى، الكردية في العصور الوسطى واللغات الأوروبية المعاصرة في العصر الحديث، ومعظمهم من الإنجليزية والفرنسية.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>العربية</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:termCode </span> <span property='schema:termCode'>Q13955</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:description </span> <span property='schema:description'>Arabic is the Classical Arabic language of the 6th century and its modern descendants, excluding Maltese. [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:image </span> <div rel='schema:image' class='label'> schema:width </span> <a href='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000712794104161' property='schema:width'>https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000712794104161</a> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:inLanguage </span> <div rel='schema:inLanguage' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000013955104231' typeof='schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible schema:Language'> <span class='type'>schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:Intangible schema:Language</span> <h1 property='rdfs:label'>العربية</h1> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:alternateName </span> <span property='schema:alternateName'>Arabic</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:identifier </span> <div rel='schema:identifier' resource='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000013955102531' typeof='schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:StructuredValue schema:Intangible schema:PropertyValue'> <span class='type'>schema:Thing rdfs:Resource schema:StructuredValue schema:Intangible schema:PropertyValue</span> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:propertyID </span> <ul> <li property='schema:sameAs'>https://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/langcodes_name.php?code_ID=22</a> </li> </ul> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:subjectOf </span> <a href='https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000013955104231' property='schema:subjectOf'>https://ontomatica.io/identifier/23010000013955104231</a> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>العربية</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:sameAs </span> <a href='https://ar.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%84%D8%BA%D8%A9_%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B9%D8%B1%D8%A8%D9%8A%D8%A9' schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Arabic [en-US] See specific Natural Language.</span> </div> </div> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:name </span> <span property='schema:name'>Arabic</span> </div> <div class='property'> <span class='label'> schema:sameAs </span> <ul> <li> <a href='https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q13955'
